exercise.rubric: Which word in the blue sentence has the strongest stress? Choose a word, click on it and then listen. If you want to change your answer, click again on your chosen word, then on a different one.

question.sentence: [She's] [got] [one] [cat], [two] [dogs] [and] [a] [pet] [*snake]. Not one cat, two dogs and a pet spider.
[She's] [got] [*one] [cat], [two] [dogs] [and] [a] [pet] [snake]. Not two cats, two dogs and a pet snake.
[They] [*play] [badminton], [tennis] [and] [squash]. They don't teach badminton, tennis and squash.
[I've] [invited] [*Janet], [Mohammed] [and] [his] [brother]. Not Michelle, Mohammed and his brother.
[I've] [invited] [Janet], [Mohammed] [and] [his] [*brother]. Not Janet, Mohammed and his sister.
